questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to learn more about how to use R more efficiently. I know the basics, I think, and I have done some data analyses before. I feel like I need to optimize my workflow to enhance especially in the setting of working with others on the same project. I also struggle with data cleaning, which is quite heavy in my current project. I hope to get more tips and info from the course to improve that.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I expect to learn more about reproducible data processing and analysis. I want to learn more about data wrangling. I hope I will be able to perform the data wrangling needed for the data sets that I am going to work with during my PhD

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I had no prior experience with using R and reproducibility. Participated in the introduction course and gained a lot of new knowledge. Hope to expand my skills and tools.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: All of it worked super well.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Being new to Git and GitHub I had a lot of problems on this part. So the links to the intro course are very nice, as following this made some of the pre-course much easier. In general easy to follow instructions. I really like the ways to check if you did it correctly throughout, instead of finishing the section and then finding out it was "wrong".

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Course explains everything step by step in one place and specific to biomedical field.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Describing text and codes worked well.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Detailed description of how to get properly setup prior to the course.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Easy to follow

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Good descriptions of what we should do and why, easy to copy the R code and nice with the references to the introductory course to recap/learn things not covered by this course.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I like that there where multiple options for some parts of the code that might not work, that shows you have experience with the code and how it acts for others.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I liked the layout of the material, with clear headings and sections/section types.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I really liked the materials and I found them very complete and easy to follow

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I was able to install the software on my own personal computer and could finish the tasks in good time. I also learned already about the different software we will use and could make myself more familiar with the course content. The pre-course tasks made me look forward to the course because it is exactly targeting my knowledge gab.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Including images and easy-to-copy Rcode made it quite easy to follow along. Links to the basic course was helpfull as well.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Interesting to use some packages and functions I haven't used before

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Overall the material is well structured, well described and easy to understand.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Overall, everything worked. And there were useful tips on what to do or not to do. As I hadn't taken the Introductory course, I had to switch to and back from several Introductory course topics, and sometimes I got lost between them - what steps I had actually covered. But that was nothing unmanageable.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The clear step by step instructions and the provided code. It is nice to have the task provided as a text you can do while reading along. However, it is very important that the "check up" outputs are provided to make sure everything went as supposed.Further, i love the simple look.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The course materials are clear, and I appreciate knowing what exactly to type in the console and the script.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: When trying to download the mmash files using the provided codes, the download could not be completed. I had to manual download from the link to get the necessary codesCodes: > mmash_link <- "https://physionet.org/static/published-projects/mmash/multilevel-monitoring-of-activity-and-sleep-in-healthy-people-1.0.0.zip"> download.file(mmash_link, destfile = here("data-raw/mmash-data.zip"))trying URL 'https://physionet.org/static/published-projects/mmash/multilevel-monitoring-of-activity-and-sleep-in-healthy-people-1.0.0.zip'Content type 'application/zip' length 23780300 bytes (22.7 MB)downloaded 15.5 MBFejl i download.file(mmash_link, destfile = here("data-raw/mmash-data.zip")) :   download from 'https://physionet.org/static/published-projects/mmash/multilevel-monitoring-of-activity-and-sleep-in-healthy-people-1.0.0.zip' failedIn addition: Advarselsbeskeder:1: I download.file(mmash_link, destfile = here("data-raw/mmash-data.zip")) :  downloaded length 0 != reported length 02: I download.file(mmash_link, destfile = here("data-raw/mmash-data.zip")) :  URL 'https://physionet.org/static/published-projects/mmash/multilevel-monitoring-of-activity-and-sleep-in-healthy-people-1.0.0.zip': Timeout of 60 seconds was reached
